member.summary: Converts an image file containing frames to an instance of .
member.param: Name for the animation.
File path to the image file.
Layout of frames in the image file: X number of columns, Y number of rows.
Duration for a frame in the animation.
Pixel padding separating frames: X between the columns, Y between the rows.
Limits the number of frames copied to the animation. X first frame index, Y last frame index.
to be used when creating the .
Callback that will be applied to each when creating a frame.
The mode used when converting the texture to a surface.
The style to use when is .
The style to use when is .
member.returns: An instance of with converted frames.
member.remarks:
This method assumes the image file contains only frames and optional padding between the frames, no border space.
Frame count is calculated by multiplying rows and columns from the frame layout. It can by limited by specifying frame start and finish indexes.
Frame size and the subsequent AnimatedScreenSurface size is calculated from the size of the image file, number of frames, padding and the font size ratio.

member.name: T:SadConsole.GameHost
member.summary: Represents the SadConsole game engine.
member.remarks:
When a new host is created, the host should do the following:
- Run `LoadDefaultFonts`. - Run `SetRenderer` for `window`, `controls`, `layered`, and `default` renderers. - Run `LoadMappedColors`. - Configure the `Screen` to a new console with `ScreenCellsX` and `ScreenCellsY`. - Prior to running the game, run `SplashScreens.SplashScreenManager.CheckRun()`.
member.summary: Represents the SadConsole game engine.

member.summary: Raised when the instruction completes.

member.summary: Raised when the instruction completes but is going to repeat.

member.summary: When true, this instruction will automatically remove itself from the parent's collection.

member.summary: Flags the instruction as completed or not. If completed, the event will be raised.

member.name: P:SadConsole.Instructions.InstructionBase.RepeatCount
member.summary: Indicates how many times this set will repeat. Use 0 to not repeat and -1 to repeat forever.
member.remarks: This property counts down each time the instruction finishes. If set to -1 it will repeat forever. As this represents how many times to repeat, setting this value to 1 would allow the instruction to execute twice, once for the original time, and again for the repeat counter of 1.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Instructions.InstructionBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets the Done flag.
member.remarks: On the base class, resets the to false. Override this method to reset the derived class' counters and status flags for the instruction.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Instructions.InstructionBase.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats the current instruction. Decrements the value (if applicable), and raises the event. This method should be overridden in derived classes to customize how the object is reset for a repeat.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Instructions.InstructionBase.Update(SadConsole.IScreenObject,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Executes the instruction. This base class method should be called from derived classes. If the IsFinished property is set to true, will try to repeat if needed and will raise all appropriate events.
member.param: The object that hosts this instruction.
The time that has elapsed since this method was last called.

member.name: M:SadConsole.Readers.Playscii.ToScreenSurface(System.String,SadConsole.IFont,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a file to a SadConsole .
member.param: Name and path of the file (give only file name if is used).
to be used when converting the file.
Path to an alternative palette file rather than the one specified in the playscii records.
If specified, the playscii file will be read from this zip archive.
member.remarks:
SadConsole does not support all the Playscii features at the moment, so the conversion will not be perfect.
Do not use tile rotation and set Z-Depth to 0 on all Playscii layers.
Transparent glyph foreground is fine, but it will not cut through the background like it does in Playscii.
member.returns: containing the first frame from the file.

member.summary: Resizes the control if the property is .
member.remarks:
When overriding this method, to perhaps restrict the requested size, make sure to do the following:
- Check if the property allows resizing. If it doesn't, throw an . - The and variables of the control are set to the values provided. - The property is set to the same width and height as values provided. Generally the theme will adjust this if needed, but it might ignore this so you'll need to set it. - The , if set, is reattached by calling . - Set to .
